title: I feel sorry for all Elise players at this point.

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Elise when played Jungle. Statistics include Elise's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Elise Jungle is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
It just saddens me to see someone play {{champion:60}} in my games, because due to her unviability I know for a fact that they are playing her simply because they enjoy her, yet aren't allowed to win games while playing a champ they genuinely like. The supposed "buff" for this patch ended up dropping her winrate by 2%, for a grand total of 41% in Plat+, literally the worst winrate in the game, and I don't believe any champion deserves to have their winrate in the very bottom of the gutter (maybe not even {{champion:7}}), especially for as long as Elise has.

I started playing on {{champion:201}} release so I wasn't playing at the time Elise was considered god-tier or even strong, so I might not have any authority to speak about her issues, but from what I have heard, the removal of her spiderform defense stats were the final nail in her coffin. Maybe just giving her back the defense stats she desperately needs in melee range would solve 90% of her problems and make her instantly playable?

I have also been told that Riot had painted themselves in a corner with Elise by giving her a kit that, while not necessarily overloaded, packs in everything a jungler could possibly want as it has fast clears, HP sustain, (partly) resourceless, and potent early ganks (which is why I also worry that one of my favorite champs {{champion:421}} will continue to get nerfed to the point that she becomes the next Elise, but that's another post).

As it stands, it feels like there is no reason to ever pick Elise, not only because she has a trash winrate, but also because it seems that the other shapeshifting AP jungler {{champion:76}} simply does everything Elise does, but better, except for hard CC which she trades for much more safety with the javelin spam (ever been bush camped by a Nidalee jg?). But even Nidalee isn't in the best of spots right now, since Riot chose to nerf her a week before they finally solved the real problem with the S5 jungle by making a worthwile tank item and making the camps easier to clear for tanks.

Well, maybe I shouldn't focus on this patch's shortcomings so much. On the bright side, the long-awaited {{champion:34}} splash is gorgeous.

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zjbrPtvR,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-06-26T22:51:08.244+0000)

> It's the same for Elise change. They _think_ it's a buff, but in reality they nerfed **TWO** things about her once more.

They gave her passive sustain instead of active, and they made her E double her spider damage AND healing
How's that not a buff?

It may not be all she needs, but it wasn't pushing her further into obscurity.

Although if you're talking about Runeglaive on Elise, then I wholeheartedly agree.

If it's about shifting her healing from an active moment of power to a less effective passive, that actually removed a weakness from her; she doesn't rely on her spiderlings for healing anymore, and she can actually pretty much get back what she had before with her E. 20 + 20% AP healing on autoattacks isn't small.

She's not where she needs to be, but I can't see this as a nerf

She needs to waste her only escape and get into melee to apply this increased healing and damage.

How is that not a nerf?

Using a mobility skill to go all in is only a waste if it doesn't work.  In other words, if you chose your moment badly.

She may still be too weak, but the fact that she gets offensive stats for using Rappel offensively is not a problem; it's one of the things that will allow them to buff her *without* creating huge balance problems where she's super strong *while* being super safe.  Having to choose is healthier gameplay.

For another example, consider Riven's infamous four dashes.  The more of them she uses to get *to* you to attack you, the less she has if she needs to get *away*.  That's what makes her not nearly as broken as she looks unless *you're* the one who gets in *her* face unwisely.

You forgot the fact that 40% CDR Riven(standard) has essentially 100% uptime on mobility.

So that's a bad example.
A champion no one can reasonably hope to escape from is bad design too - not saying that's necessarily Riven's case, but "it's offensive!" isn't a guarantee of healthy design.

The active sustain was better than the passive sustain for the duration it was active, and Elise actually didn't have significant sustain problems. Decent clearing and spiderling tanking allowed her to stay pretty healthy, and you could use spider W on most camps for sustain anyway. Having the higher active sustain for a duration in a fight can be a lot more valuable than having a lesser passive sustain all the time, particularly as the game goes on. The E change could help make up for this, but in practice you don't really get to E on top of people very often, and you have to have E leveled in order to get good benefits from it. It's almost always better to save it for damage avoidance or escaping, so you often don't get to make good use of the bonus from the E. The end result is that your sustain really doesn't benefit at all.

I wouldn't say it's really a nerf overall, but it's not a buff. Her winrate is probably down because people are screwing themselves trying to make Runeglaive work. They'll give up and go back to Cinderhulk in a week or so, and her winrate will go back to what it was.
